content: this legal case involves two parties one of which is not named the viru county court made a decision on 08092023 after the case had been ongoing for 3 years and 7 months the court ruled that one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs but the exact amount was not specified the final resolution of the court was that the case has been resolved and ended the parties involved reached a compromise regarding the ownership of two properties one property will remain solely owned by the claimant while the defendant will retain sole ownership of the other property the claimant agreed to pay the defendant a compensation amount of 2750 euros within 7 days a vehicle and a trailer will be sold at a public auction with the proceeds divided equally between the parties the parties also agreed to bear their own costs in the proceedings the defendants request for procedural assistance was refused and the civil case is terminated the procedural costs mentioned in the compromise will be subject to compensation the state fee overpaid by the parties will be returned the ministry of finance provided information about the appeal procedure giving the appellant 15 days to submit an appeal to the tartu district court or viru county court the appellant must also pay a state fee for the appeal if the appellant requests procedural aid they must perform certain actions within the given time limit the court may provide a reasonable deadline for the appellant to justify their appeal or pay the state fee the court clarifies that the procedural deadline can be reinstated in this specific case the court dealt with a divorce and the division of joint assets a partial decision was made regarding the divorce claim and the procedure continued for the division of joint assets the parties reached a compromise and requested confirmation to terminate the proceedings the court examined the compromise and found it justified so the proceedings were terminated and the compromise was approved the court specified the location of a real estate property mentioned in the compromise the court also explained the consequences of terminating the proceedings and confirmed that the parties could file a new lawsuit if needed the court mentioned that if a party fails to fulfill their obligations according to the agreement the creditor has the right to turn to a bailiff for enforcement additionally the claimant filed a counterclaim and requested procedural assistance the court proposed that the parties reach a compromise and provided several court hearing dates for them to assess the value of the real estate the parties were given an opportunity to reach an agreement and evaluate the value of the assets the document refers to specific code articles which are legal provisions that apply to the case the document provides a summary of each step taken in the case the court mentioned the procedural costs of the compromise except for the costs of providing state legal aid to the defendant and the cost of expertise for which the court exempted the defendant from paying the court also mentioned that the procedural costs mentioned in the case will be reimbursed to the parties the court will consider additional costs incurred by the claimant to resolve the case such as valuation costs for real estate the claimant has requested the return of half of the state fee paid for filing the claim the court agreed with the claimants request and returned the overpaid fee additionally the court determined that the claimant should be refunded half of the state fee paid for the division of joint assets
